findings.issue: Missing alt text on hero images
findings.description: The main hero section contains 3 images without alt attributes. Screen reader users cannot understand the visual content, violating WCAG 2.1 Level A requirements.
findings.suggestion: Add descriptive alt text to all images that convey meaning. Decorative images should have empty alt attributes.

findings.issue: Low color contrast in navigation links
findings.description: Navigation links use #4A5568 on #1A2332 background, resulting in a contrast ratio of 3.2:1, which fails WCAG AA standards (requires 4.5:1 for normal text).
findings.suggestion: Increase text color contrast to meet WCAG AA standards. Use a lighter shade like #E2E8F0 or add background hover states.

findings.description: Contact form has 2 input fields without associated label elements or aria-labels, making them inaccessible to screen readers.
findings.suggestion: Add proper label elements for all form inputs, or use aria-label attributes for icon-only inputs.
findings.codeSnippet:
<label for="email">Email Address</label>
<input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

findings.issue: Missing skip to main content link
findings.description: No skip navigation link is provided, forcing keyboard users to tab through repetitive navigation elements on every page load.
findings.suggestion: Add a skip link as the first focusable element to allow users to bypass navigation and jump to main content.

findings.issue: No error handling for form submissions
findings.description: Form submissions fail silently without user feedback, leaving users confused about whether their action was successful.
findings.suggestion: Implement clear error messages and success confirmations for all form submissions. Use visual feedback and ARIA live regions.
findings.codeSnippet:
{error &&

Please check your input

}

findings.description: Primary CTA buttons lack visual distinction and clear labeling. Users may struggle to identify the main action on the page.
findings.suggestion: Enhance button visibility with stronger contrast, larger size, and action-oriented text like "Get Started" instead of generic "Click Here".

findings.description: The mobile hamburger menu lacks clear visual feedback when opened, and menu items are too small for touch targets (less than 44x44px).
findings.suggestion: Increase touch target sizes to at least 44x44px and add visual indicators (animations, backdrop) when menu is open.

findings.description: Multi-level pages lack breadcrumb navigation, making it difficult for users to understand their location and navigate back.
findings.suggestion: Add breadcrumb navigation for pages deeper than 2 levels in the site hierarchy.

findings.description: Primary brand color varies between #0066CC and #0077DD across different pages, creating visual inconsistency and brand confusion.
findings.suggestion: Establish a design system with defined color palette and ensure consistent application across all pages and components.

findings.description: Layout breaks at unexpected screen sizes due to inconsistent breakpoint usage, causing poor mobile and tablet experiences.
findings.suggestion: Define consistent breakpoint system (mobile: 768px, tablet: 1024px, desktop: 1280px) and test across all viewports.

findings.description: Section spacing varies between 32px, 48px, and 64px without a clear pattern, creating visual inconsistency.
findings.suggestion: Establish a consistent spacing scale (e.g., 8px base unit) and apply it consistently across all sections.

findings.description: Heading sizes don't follow a consistent scale. H1 uses 48px while H2 uses 36px, but H3 jumps to 28px instead of maintaining ratio.
findings.suggestion: Establish a consistent typographic scale (e.g., 1.25x or 1.5x ratio) and apply it consistently across all heading levels.

findings.issue: Uncompressed images causing slow load times
findings.description: Hero images are 2-3MB each without compression, causing 8-12 second load times on 3G connections and high bounce rates.
findings.suggestion: Compress all images using tools like TinyPNG or ImageOptim. Target file sizes under 200KB for hero images.

findings.description: All images are served in JPEG/PNG format. Converting to WebP could reduce file sizes by 25-35%, improving page load times.
findings.suggestion: Convert images to WebP format with fallbacks for older browsers. Use responsive images with srcset.

findings.issue: No lazy loading for below-fold images
findings.description: All images load immediately, including those below the fold. This increases initial page load time unnecessarily.
findings.suggestion: Implement lazy loading for images below the fold using the loading="lazy" attribute or Intersection Observer API.

findings.issue: Missing resource hints for external fonts
findings.description: External Google Fonts load without preconnect hints, adding 200-300ms to font load time.
findings.suggestion: Add preconnect and dns-prefetch hints for external font resources to improve load performance.

findings.description: The page lacks a meta description tag, which impacts search engine visibility and click-through rates from search results.
findings.suggestion: Add a compelling meta description (150-160 characters) that summarizes the page content and includes relevant keywords.
findings.codeSnippet: <meta name="description" content="Your compelling 150-character description here that includes key terms and value proposition.">

findings.description: The page lacks structured data markup, missing opportunities for rich snippets in search results.
findings.suggestion: Add JSON-LD structured data for Organization, WebSite, or Article schema depending on content type.

findings.issue: Missing Open Graph tags for social sharing
findings.description: No Open Graph meta tags are present, resulting in poor preview cards when the page is shared on social media platforms.
findings.suggestion: Add Open Graph meta tags (og:title, og:description, og:image) to improve social media sharing appearance.
findings.codeSnippet:
<meta property="og:title" content="Page Title">
<meta property="og:description" content="Page description">
<meta property="og:image" content="image-url.jpg">

findings.description: No canonical tag is specified, which may cause duplicate content issues if the page is accessible via multiple URLs.
findings.suggestion: Add a canonical URL tag to indicate the preferred version of the page for search engines.
